required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Causes of Discrepant Clinic in Monogenic Twins
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Causes of Discrepant Clinic in Monogenic Twins

brief_summary.textblock: In the DISCO-TWIN study (prospective, open-label molecular-genetic study), twin pairs with one healthy and one affected twin with molecularly undiagnosed diseases will be analysed by means of omics technologies and/ or re-analysed using existing datasets. Phenotype and omics data will be shared within the University Hospital Tübingen and with external collaborators to improve the diagnostic rate of the subjects included in the study.

primary_outcome.description: Number of new Candidate Genes for complex or serious diseases through a comparative genetic analysis of monozygotic clinically discordant twins

secondary_outcome.description: Number characterizations of the identified putative disease causes.
Number of patients receiving appropriate therapy after successful diagnosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of molecular causes of diagnostically unclear rare diseases
secondary_outcome.description: Number of molecular causes of diagnostically unclear rare diseases

arm_group.description: Twin with unclear rare diseases, clinically characterized in the context of outpatient/ inpatient standard care at the University Hospital Tübingen (UKT) or cooperating location.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood sampling for NGS analysis and other omics analysis (transcriptomics, proteomics, metabolomics), functional cell biology studies (for example in fibroblast cultures).

study_pop.textblock: Twin pair monozygotic clinically (phenotypic) discordant twins

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Twin pair monozygotic clinically (phenotypic) discordant twins
- Unclear diagnosis
- Suspected (mono-)genetic cause of the disease in one twin
Exclusion Criteria:
- Missing informed consent of both twin/ legal representative
- No distinct phenotype
